content.description: Starts on the prominent iron feature on the lower right side of the boulder when looking up hill. Climb up and right using the left hand jug mid face to build feet and find a decent iron rail up and right for the top out.
content.location: Starts on the prominent iron feature on the lower right side of the boulder

content.description: Left hand starts in an undercling left of the main horizontal rail and right hand undercling below the rail.  Move up and left onto the blank face.  Use your cat-like reflexes to finesse the classic sandstone slopers.
content.location: To the right of Goose Head

content.description: Start as per Humble abode and move out and right on the arete.
content.location: Start as per Humble abode and move out and right on the arete.

content.description: Starts on the far right uphill side of the boulder, to the right of 'Essential Endeavors'.  Look for a prominent left facing side pull rail just below a perfect pinch formed by two small pockets next to each other.  Left hand starts on the side pull rail and the right hand a few feet to the right on a small in-cut diagonal crimp.  Figure out the delicate feet to move up and left through the pocket pinch and small crimp to a large gaston for the left hand.
content.location: Starts on the far right uphill side of the boulder, to the right of 'Essential Endeavors'.

content.description: Look for the arete with prominent iron plates on the left uphill side of the boulder. Start compressed down low with the right hand in a hidden jug. Work up through the iron plates, one of which resembles a goose head. Build feet to work through the sloping top.
content.location: The arete with prominent iron plates on the left uphill side of the boulder.

content.description: Start as per Good and Gather.  Continue straight up through the slab on some classy slopers and avoid going out right.  Get good and slabber before the air mantle to top out.
content.location: Start as per Good N Gather

content.description: Located lower left side of the boulder when looking up hill. Start down low on the prominent rail and work up through the gnarly iron swirl. Match feet and use the slopers to make a delicate step out right to an amazing, rounded edge. Press off the right foot and find the mono on the flat part of the sloper up and right. Keep building and walking feet to the top.
content.location: Located lower left side of the boulder when looking up hill.

content.description: Starts to the right of Peaceful Journey on the two lowest iron crimps. Move off the two small crimps to another iron crimp rail. Build feet and work up through some amazing features of sloped pinches and sloped jugs.
content.location: Starts to the right of Peaceful Journey

content.description: Located on the left up hill side of the boulder. Start matched on the prominent vertical rail and move up and left. Look for the large jug groove on top.
content.location: The left up hill side of the boulder.

content.description: Just to the right of ‘Good and Gather’. Look for the big arete and start down low on some horizontal rails. Move through some decent crimps, a sidepull, and slopers to get a left hand on the prominent edge up and left. Hold the tension to build feet and find a side pull out right. Mantle straight up and keep walking and building feet to the top.
content.location: Just to the right of ‘Good and Gather’.

content.description: Starts on the prominent iron feature on the lower right side of the boulder when looking up hill. Climb up and left the main slab arete feature.

Just to the right of Bag of Rattles. Starts down low in some good horizontal seams. Move up to a sloper and finesse the undercling to reach up and right to a crimp rail. Match on the crimp and get ready to double up on another crimp rail. Build feet and navigate the tall and delicate top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Bag of Rattles.

content.description: This is the big boulder between the Scoop boulder and Always Sunny bloc. Lovely features and excellent friction slopers and pinches. Mostly good landings.
